article: The other day as I talked with a friend I _ a story that I heard this summer."A{n} _ person, seeing a butterfly struggling to free itself from its cocoon, and wanting to help, very _ loosed the filaments to form a(n) _ . The butterfly was freed, got out of the _ , and moved its wings about _ could not fly. What the sympathetic person did not know was that only through the _ struggle can the wings grow strong enough for flight. Its shortened life was spent on the ground ; it never knew freedom, _ really lived." I call it learning to love with an open hand. It is a _ which has come slowly to me and has been wrought in the fires of pain and in the waters of patience. I am learning that I must _ the one I love, for if I hold firmly and try to control , I shall lose what I try to control _ . As I learn and practice more and more, I can say to the one I love, "I love you, I value you, I respect you and I trust that you have the _ to become all that it is possible for you to become -- if I don't get in your way. I love you so much that I can set you free to walk beside me in _ and in sadness. I will _ your tears but I will not ask you not to cry. I will care and _ you, but I will not hold you up when you can walk alone. I will try to listen to your meaning as well as your word, but I shall not always agree. I can not _ be with you or hear what you say for there are times _ I must listen to myself and care for myself."
